page.title: 08 Orchard Park - Reality
page.content: The spaceousness is a myth. The countryside is not readily accessible to the suburban "towny". The invasion of adjacent farmland by youthful motorcyclists and even younger children wanting to play in the hay at harvest time is not appreciated by the local farmers. And a well planned adventure play park and mini-golf course on the edge of the Estate seem little used. True the Barmston and Beverley land drain that skirts the eastern edge of the Estate is a rod fisherman's haven and some young people even swim there. But sadly it seems its greatest use is as a rubbish dump especially for supermarket trolleys, old washers and cookers. The ordered ranks of pebble dash terraces present a dull prospect at ground level and only 20 years on the sub- urban estate is fraying at the edges.
